wikipedia_page.main: John Penrose (5 May 1850 – 21 April 1932) was a British archer who competed at the 1908 Summer Olympics in London. Penrose entered the double York round event in 1908, taking fourth place with 709 points.

link_mentions.page: Archery at the 1908 Summer Olympics – Men's double York round
response: Dod was not favoured. Reginald Brooks-King had won five British national titles since 1900 (1900, 1902, 1903, 1906, and 1908), with John Penrose, John Bridges, Eyre Hussey (not competing at the London Games), and Hugh Nesham each taking one of the remaining four.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1908 Summer Olympics

response: John Penrose (born 1964) is the British Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) for Weston-super-Mare.
John Penrose may also refer to:
*John Penrose (MP for Liskeard), in 1411, MP for Liskeard (parliamentary borough)
*John Penrose (journalist), British journalist, former husband of Anne Robinson
* John Penrose (clergyman) (1778–1859), Church of England clergyman and theological writer
* John Penrose (politician) (born 1964), British Conservative member of Parliament
* John Penrose (Parliamentarian) (born 1611), English member of Parliament
